title: League lags horribly on brand new laptop, suggestions for raising frame rate please
body: I recently bought a Dell Inspiron 15 and the fps get so bad, even after I took off v sync, anti alias, put the quality on very low, disabled music and some other sounds, and the frames still hit like 3 fps in teamfights and like 15-30 fps in regular laning.  My old laptop was a Lenovo Ideapad s210 touch, and the keys stopped working on it, but I don't understand how that tiny crappy little laptop, where I didn't have to disable half the stuff in league could run league better than my new one.  Any suggestions on raising my frame rate?

replies.body: Hey, I know it's alomg shot, but check your power options. Set it to high performance. On new laptops it is set to balanced when plugged and to power saving when unplugged, it stops your laptop from using all resources. Shoul find power options bottom right corner (battery logo) or by typing power options in search bar in start menu.

WeeGaffer has a couple good suggestions. Sometimes all you need to do is check for some driver updates, but if that doesn't work check out the other steps in our [**FPS guide**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752684-Low-Frame-Rate-FPS-Troubleshooting) as well. Hit me back up if that doesn't seem to help though!

Does that laptop have an onboard graphics card? Try updating the drivers maybe and disabling any other non essential back ground apps.

EDIT; have you tried in windowed mode as well?
